summary: This document is an email chain from May 2020 between the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York and attorneys from Kaplan Hecker & Fink LLP regarding a request for information relating to Jeffrey Epstein. The emails discuss the submission of a Touhy request to the Department of Justice for documents in connection with pending litigation against Epstein's estate.

persons.name: Kate L. Doniger
persons.context: Attorney at Kaplan Hecker & Fink LLP corresponding with the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding a request for information on Jeffrey Epstein for pending litigation.

persons.name: Roberta Kaplan
persons.context: Attorney at Kaplan Hecker & Fink LLP (referred to as 'Robbie') who is the primary subject of the initial request for information from the DOJ regarding Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Alexandra Conlon
persons.context: Attorney or legal staff at Kaplan Hecker & Fink LLP who sends communications on behalf of Roberta Kaplan and is copied on correspondence regarding the Epstein information request.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the information request; the emails concern litigation against his estate.

persons.name: Robert Kaplan
persons.context: Named in the filename of an attached letter ('042120_Letter_to_Robert_Kaplan_re_Request_for_Information_Relating_toJeffrey_Epstein.pdf'), likely a recipient of official correspondence.

connections.description: Both are attorneys at Kaplan Hecker & Fink LLP working together on the request for information relating to Jeffrey Epstein.
Conlon sends emails on behalf of Roberta Kaplan and is copied on related correspondence, indicating a working relationship.
Both are part of the legal team at Kaplan Hecker & Fink LLP corresponding about the Epstein information request.
Kaplan is involved in pending litigation against Jeffrey Epstein's estate, as indicated in the Touhy request.

events.title: Initial DOJ Letter to Roberta Kaplan
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York sends an initial letter to Roberta Kaplan regarding her request for information on Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Submission of Touhy Request
events.description: Attorneys from Kaplan Hecker & Fink LLP, on behalf of Roberta Kaplan, submit a formal Touhy request and supporting exhibit to the DOJ for documents related to litigation against Epstein's estate.

events.title: DOJ Response with Documents
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office responds to the request, providing a letter and a set of documents identified in the letter, with a password-protected file sent separately.

keyFacts: Attorneys from Kaplan Hecker & Fink LLP submitted a Touhy request to the Department of Justice for documents relating to Jeffrey Epstein for use in pending litigation against his estate.
The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was responsive to the request, providing a letter and a set of documents in April 2020.
The correspondence indicates ongoing civil litigation against Jeffrey Epstein's estate following his death.
The attached documents were sent in an encrypted file, with the password provided separately, highlighting the sensitive nature of the requested information.
